alert.note: Alert for Athens; Morgan; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 12:07AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Washington, central Morgan, southeastern Athens and northwestern Wood Counties through 1245 AM EDT... At 1206 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Beverly, moving south at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Belpre, McConnelsville, Beverly, Coolville, Chesterhill, Vienna, Washington, Lubeck, Boaz, North Hills, Malta, Stockport, Bristol, Hackney, Little Hocking, Fleming, Blennerhassett, and Bartlett. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 175 and 178. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
